pr_title: GEODE-7672: add dunit test to verify OQL index after PR clear.

timeline.message: GEODE-7672: add dunit test to verify OQL index after PR clear.

timeline.bodyText: The assertions here could be executed before region.clear() in line 148, or even before the region is populated. There is no guarantee when the code block in invokeAsync is executed.
timeline.author: jchen21

replies.bodyText:
yes, it will keep on executing the query until it's returning 0 results.
There is a slight chance that this could get executed even before the region is populated, that's why I put a pollDelay there to reduce this chance.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

replies.bodyText:
I am not sure I understand the purpose of this test. Depends on the thread scheduling, the query result size could be non-zero. e.g. if the query is executed after populating the region, but before clearing the region.
The test result is non-deterministic. This test is flaky.
replies.author: jchen21

replies.bodyText: the await().untilAsserted() method will keep on executing the code block inside until it's successful or until it timed out. This test is trying to execute clear() and query() at the same time, and make sure that query will eventually return 0 results with no errors.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: The City class is defined in another package used by other tests. Any changes in City could potentially break the test. I would recommend using a class defined within the test itself. It is easier to maintain the code.
timeline.author: jchen21

replies.bodyText: Yes, the PR is also to make sure this change won't break other tests. It's better not to make a different class if we can just add an id field and also not breaking others.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.message: GEODE-7672: add dunit test to verify OQL index after PR clear.
require rvv lock when create index
require rvv lock when create index
require rvv lock when create index

timeline.author: agingade

replies.bodyText: I believe even with just one iteration, it's still a range index. There are only 2 kinds of index now: range or key. Hash is deprecated.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText: If the idea is to get clear and index to be happening parallel, this may not guarantee that. There is a IndexManager.testHook that can be used to control index creation. And having more entries will help chances of occurring clear and create-index in parallel.
timeline.author: agingade

replies.bodyText: I would prefer not to use testHooks if I can help it. I increased the region size to 1000 and do clear for multiple times to increase the chance of concurrency.
replies.author: jinmeiliao

timeline.bodyText:
This is a way to see how many entries are there in index. With this we need to make sure the query has used index.
Along with that it will be nice to validate the index storage size: it could be done by calling  isEmpty() on Index class or using the index stats (as done in other places in this test)
timeline.author: agingade

timeline.bodyText: The asserts here should probably be await.untilAsserted's. Judging from the DUnit failure.
timeline.author: mhansonp

timeline.bodyText: Would this be better as an await.untilAsserted?
timeline.author: mhansonp

replies.bodyText: this method is called AFTER clear is done, so it should be 0 at this point all the time.
replies.author: jinmeiliao
